title: Using Rotenone Plants for Fish Stunning
brief: Identify and use plants containing rotenone to stun fish in warm water environments.
steps: Step 1: Use only in water 21Â°C (70Â°F) or above for quick effectiveness - works slowly 10-21Â°C, ineffective below 10Â°C.
Step 2: Target ponds or headwaters of small streams rather than large flowing rivers.
Step 3: Crush Anamirta cocculus bean-shaped seeds (South Asia/South Pacific vines) and throw in water.
Step 4: Crush Croton tiglium seeds from three-angled capsules (South Pacific waste areas) into water.
Step 5: Crush Barringtonia seeds and bark (large trees near sea in Malaya/Polynesia) and use in water.
Step 6: Grind Derris eliptica roots to powder, mix with water, throw large quantity into fishing area.
Step 7: Collect all affected fish immediately as they rise helplessly to surface.
warnings: Gather all dead fish quickly - many floating downstream could arouse enemy suspicion.
Only effective in warm water temperatures above 21Â°C (70Â°F).
Ensure positive plant identification before use - some tropical plants are toxic to humans.
Rotenone is safe for humans eating the fish but lethal to cold-blooded animals.
